DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study Stenting , Paclitaxel Eluting Balloon Atherectomy Treat Peripheral Artery Disease
DOC.detailed_description: The superficial femoral artery common place arteriosclerosis patient symptomatic low extremity vascular disease . Advances percutaneous transluminal angioplasty ( PTA ) stenting provide new option treatment disease arterial segment . Despite initial technical success rate 95 % late clinical failure remain important concern . Restenosis PTA occur 40-60 % within one year . Percutaneous removal obstructive material atherectomy may reduce restenosis rate . So far , data support excisional atherectomy derive registry . Another attempt reduce restenosis use paclitaxel elute balloon ( PEB ) . First clinical study suggest use PEBs percutaneous treatment femoropopliteal disease associate significant reduction late lumen loss target-lesion revascularization . There randomize comparison three different interventional strategy . Thus aim study evaluate efficacy strategy term reduction diameter stenosis follow-up angiogram .
